H0.text: An upward force equal to the weight of the wood is exerted by the water, causing a piece of pine wood to float on the surface of a lake.

H1.text: A downward force equal to the weight of the wood is exerted by the water, which causes a piece of pine wood to float on the surface of a lake.

H2.text: An upward force equal to the weight of the displaced water is what the lake exerts, enabling a piece of pine wood to float on its surface.

H3.text: A downward force equal to the weight of the displaced water is what the water exerts on a piece of pine wood that floats on the surface of a lake.

A4.text: Any floating object displaces its own weight of fluid.

A5.text: The buoyant force (Fb) on an object is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the object.
